question_text: What is the best treatment for peak dose dyskinesia in patients with Parkinson's disease?

options.A: Increase levodopa’s dose

question_text: What is the benefit of deep brain stimulation of the subthalamic nucleus?

options.A: Dyskinesia
patient with Parkinson's disease presents with increased dyskinesia and parkinsonism. He is on Levodopa 100/25 mg every 6 hours. What should be done next?

typical case of orthostatic tremor is presented. What is the recommended treatment?

patient who works as a chef has been complaining of a months-long history of upper limb resting tremor and rigidity. During the examination, he was found to have unilateral bradykinesia and resting tremor. The patient also mentioned he has a gambling problem. What will you do?

question_text: What is the next investigation for a patient with orthostatic tremor?

options.A: NCS/EMG

question_text: Deep brain stimulation (DBS) of the globus pallidus interna (GPi) may be more effective than DBS of the subthalamic nucleus (STN) in treating which of the following features of Parkinson's disease?

options.A: Bradykinesia

question_text: What is the recommended treatment for a patient with Parkinson's Disease (PD) who has features of Restless Legs Syndrome (RLS)?

options.A: Dopamine agonist

question_text: Which of the following Parkinsonian disorders commonly presents with asymmetrical features?

options.A: MSA

question_text: Which of the following describes orthostatic tremor?

options.A: It improves with walking.
options.B: It is characterized by unsteadiness on standing and a high frequency tremor in the legs.
options.C: The typical onset is in the sixth decade of life.
options.D: It is associated with resting tremor and bradykinesia

options.A: female presents with action and intention tremor, dropping things, and a slightly asymmetric family history. What is the most likely diagnosis?

question_text: What is the treatment for hemifacial spasm?

options.A: Botox

60-year-old male presents with recent onset of progressive difficulty using the right hand. Clinically, he is found to have right hand myoclonus, rigidity, and cortical sensory loss, with no history of falls. What is the most likely diagnosis?

question_text: In a scenario of orthostatic tremor not responding to clonazepam, which of the following is a second-line treatment?

options.A: Levodopa

question_text: Which of the following is most likely to be associated with essential palatal myoclonus?

options.A: Most likely due to stroke
patient with idiopathic Parkinson disease, complaining of hallucinations, has mild rigidity and bradykinesia with minimal dyskinesia. What medication should be discontinued?

question_text: What type of focal dystonia improves when touching the face?

options.A: Torticollis

question_text: Which of the following symptoms is the most common side effect of botulinum toxin injection for cervical dystonia?

options.A: Muscle weakness
options.D: Localized pain at the injection site
